verses.text: And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto Moses , Speak unto the priests the sons of Aaron , and say unto them, There shall none be defiled for the dead among his people :
But for his kin , that is near unto him, \add that is\add*, for his mother , and for his father , and for his son , and for his daughter , and for his brother ,
And for his sister a virgin , that is nigh unto him, which hath had no husband ; for her may he be defiled.

\add But\add* he shall not defile himself, \add being\add* a chief man among his people , to profane himself.\f + \fr 21.4 \ft he…: or, being an husband among his people, he shall not defile himself for his wife, etc\f*
They shall not make baldness upon their head , neither shall they shave off the corner of their beard , nor make any cuttings in their flesh.

They shall be holy unto their God , and not profane the name of their God : for the offerings of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* made by fire , \add and\add* the bread of their God , they do offer : therefore they shall be holy.
They shall not take a wife \add that is\add* a whore , or profane ; neither shall they take a woman put away from her husband : for he \add is\add* holy unto his God.
Thou shalt sanctify him therefore; for he offereth the bread of thy God : he shall be holy unto thee: for I the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, which sanctify you, \add am\add* holy. \p
¶ And the daughter of any priest , if she profane herself by playing the whore , she profaneth her father : she shall be burnt with fire. \p

And \add he that is\add* the high priest among his brethren , upon whose head the anointing oil was poured , and that is consecrated to put on the garments , shall not uncover his head , nor rend his clothes ;
Neither shall he go in to any dead body , nor defile himself for his father , or for his mother ;

Neither shall he go out of the sanctuary , nor profane the sanctuary of his God ; for the crown of the anointing oil of his God \add is\add* upon him: I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
And he shall take a wife in her virginity.
A widow , or a divorced woman , or profane , \add or\add* an harlot , these shall he not take : but he shall take a virgin of his own people to wife.
Neither shall he profane his seed among his people : for I the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* do sanctify him. \p
¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto Moses , saying ,

Speak unto Aaron , saying , Whosoever \add he be\add* of thy seed in their generations that hath \add any\add* blemish , let him not approach to offer the bread of his God.\f + \fr 21.17 \ft bread: or, food\f*
For whatsoever man \add he be\add* that hath a blemish , he shall not approach : a blind man , or a lame , or he that hath a flat nose , or any thing superfluous ,
Or a man that is brokenfooted , or brokenhanded ,
Or crookbackt , or a dwarf , or that hath a blemish in his eye , or be scurvy , or scabbed , or hath his stones broken ;\f + \fr 21.20 \ft a dwarf: or, too slender\f*

No man that hath a blemish of the seed of Aaron the priest shall come nigh to offer the offerings of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* made by fire : he hath a blemish ; he shall not come nigh to offer the bread of his God.
He shall eat the bread of his God , \add both\add* of the most holy , and of the holy.
Only he shall not go in unto the vail , nor come nigh unto the altar , because he hath a blemish ; that he profane not my sanctuaries : for I the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* do sanctify them.
And Moses told \add it\add* unto Aaron , and to his sons , and unto all the children of Israel.
